Text: curvesme know what else you need I just gave you the blended X price and you can do whatever averages you want Claire

heat ratesquestion Do the heat rates you have in your spreadsheet change with the addition of chillers We are looking at an LM deal in Entergy in which the customer would add chillers no cost to us and I wonder if this changes heat rate Thanks for your time Claire X Forwarded by Berney C AucoinHOUECT on AM Benjamin Rogers AM To Berney C CT cc Scott CT Mike J CT Subject heat rates Here are the Regional Heat Rates that should help you with the structuring models Give me a call if you have any questions Ben Forwarded by Benjamin RogersHOUECT on AM Bruce NRONDEVELOPMENT AM To Benjamin CT cc Subject heat rates Ben the four regional heat rates Bruce

Enron Training Ride Bluebonnet Expresssaid you guys might show for the Sun ride Im doing the miles but you could do or Maybe Ill see you there Claire X Forwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Amelia NRON PM To Amelia NRON cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject Enron Training Ride Bluebonnet Express Enron Training Ride March Bluebonnet Express March The rd ride of Dan Lyons fourride training series leading up to the MS will be Saturday March as described below along with subsequent rides in the series The terrain will range from what Dan considers to be light hills through moderately hilly to hilly and the traffic on each ride will be light to moderate The rides will not be sagged although each of the rides will have stores at various distances and riders should come prepare d with water food and the equipment necessary to repair flat tires The goa l will be to ride these rides at a pace between MPH and to get in a litt le hill work before the MS Although prior commitment is not a requirement Dan would appreciate some kind of a head count so if you plan on doing one or more of these rides please email him at or leave hi m a voice mail at All rides will leave promptly at am so be sure to arrive in time to be ready for a wheels up departure at am Look for Dan in his electric blue Explorer of ancient vintage Saturday March This ride will start from Magnolia Jr High School in Magnolia on FM just south of FM This ride will go north to Plantersville do a loop to the west and then come back via Dobbin This i s a moderately hilly ride Mileage low s March This ride will start from Royal Jr High School in Pattison abou t three miles north of Brookshire off of either FM or FM This is a moderately hilly ride that goes up through Burleigh and Racoon Bend to Belville and back by way of FM and FM Mileage low s April This ride will leave from the Tomball middle school on FM in downtown Tomball about a mile east of the intersection of FM and FM This is a hilly ride It will go north through Egypt and Honea up t o Montgomery and then north and west to Richards in Grimes County via the Sam Houston National Forest It will then loop west and south coming back via Dacus and Dobbin This century will get you ready for the big ride Hope to see you says Dan Sunday March the Bluebonnet Express please see attached for more details and if youre not registered its too late to register online bu t you can do so by fax or you can sign up the day of the ride Please join u s for this fantastic ride We usually have lots of Enron riders and its a very important training ride for the MS conditioning

MS Making a List Checking it TwiceForwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Amelia NRON PM To Amelia NRON cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject Making a List Checking it Twice Hey Team Here we are weeks away from the MS at and growing Please check the list and if your name is not here and you think it should be please let me know ASAP We have a VERY IMPORTANT DEADLINE on MARCH Thats the day the MS Society determines team size and thats when we qualify for our SUPER START The largest team as of March starts first If you rode with us last year youll recall going out the gate first which is the only way to travel I cant count you as registered unless you let me know youve registered with the MS Society or we have registered you through Enron If you have any friends thinking about joining the team its really important to get that done by March Of course you can still register after that date but the fee raises to and we ask your support in getting all our riders listed as soon as possible THANK YOU FOR RIDING WITH ENRON

MS training ride scheduleForwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Stephanie Strong PM To Stephanie CT cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject MS training ride schedule Attached is the MS Training Ride Schedule The first ride is this Sunday Jan at am not at Memorial Park I spoke to the folks at West U Schwinn and they verified the time change The meeting area is at the large parking lot before you enter the picnic loop The picnic loop is located on the other side of Memorial across from the running trail If you have any questions please give me a call Thanks PS This ride is for all levels of riders Steph

MS RegistrationForwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Amelia NRON PM To Amelia NRON cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject MS Registration Just to clarify if you are an Enron Cycling Club member Enron will pay for your registration Contact me or Stephanie Strong and well get you signed up For nonEnron people who want to be on the MS Enron team they can do so by registering themselves and listing Enron as their team However theyre not officially on the Enron team until we are notified and we must have their email address and phone number also exact spelling of the name as it appeared on the registration or fax the registration form to HERES A MESSAGE FROM THE MS SOCIETY Are you registered for the ISUZU MS Bike Tour presented by The Home Depot yet If not then please join us for a registration Happy Hour this Thursday February from to pm at the Hooters Restaurant located at Woodlake Square Houston TX Click on the address for a map Were happy to announce that Hooters will again provide dinner at the new finish line in Austin on Sunday April Applied Materials located on Highway in Austin will host the finish line this year Look for their team on the Tour led by Ken Haase Maps of the route can be found online at mapshtm and in the rider manual If you cant make it this Thursday then join us at one of these other Hooters locations Hooters Anderson Lane Austin to on Tuesday February Hooters FM West to on Thursday February Hooters Round Rock Austin to on Tuesday February Hooters Riverside Downtown Austin to on Tuesday March Hooters NASA to on Thursday March Hooters Mangum to on Thursday March For more information please visit our official website wwwmsorg where you can register online signup for online donations and signup to volunteer Its fast easy and secure If youre not planning to ride then join us as a volunteer Check out the volunteer signup section on the website where you can choose volunteer areas of your choice As of February people have registered online people have made online donations in the amount of people have signed up to volunteer and have signed up on our email subscription list Click here to signup for online donations contributehtm Also check out the Discussion Groups in the Talk to section of our website There are different Discussion Groups where you can post questions suggestions tips advice or comments about the bike tour Whether youre looking for tips on how to train for the ride or how to raise money youll get your answers here Click here to start talking talkhtm Thanks for supporting the National MS Society The National Multiple Sclerosis Society supports more MS research and serves more people with MS than any national voluntary MS organization in the world The National Multiple Sclerosis Society one thing people with MS can count on

Re MS RegistrationForwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Amelia NRON PM To Claire CT cc Subject Re MS Registration Claire Im glad you enjoyed the meeting and were glad to have you on the team Ill keep you posted on everything by email I cant sign you up for the MS without your signature so either stop by by office AC or Stephanie Strong EB or drop by the meeting tomorrow in C at pm and pick up a form fill out and sign give back to one of us Or if you dont have time for that let me know and Ill mail it to you company mail Thanks Claire CT PM To Amelia NRON cc Subject Re MS Registration Amelia I enjoyed the meeting today It was very helpful for me as I am not a very experienced biker Im in really good shape but I am not a biking fool and it was good to hear about rides sponsored during the week It was also helpful to learn about the inspection sticker and I will bring my bike in on March if that is still the date at which we can have them inspected Please let me know about when the mechanics class will be held too I need to know how to change my tires Can you please sign me up for the MS Heres the info I think you need and let me know if you need any other info Thanks very much for your time Claire X Claire Broido H W Maroneal Houston TX DOB Amelia NRON PM To Amelia NRON cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject MS Registration Just to clarify if you are an Enron Cycling Club member Enron will pay for your registration Contact me or Stephanie Strong and well get you signed up For nonEnron people who want to be on the MS Enron team they can do so by registering themselves and listing Enron as their team However theyre not officially on the Enron team until we are notified and we must have their email address and phone number also exact spelling of the name as it appeared on the registration or fax the registration form to HERES A MESSAGE FROM THE MS SOCIETY Are you registered for the ISUZU MS Bike Tour presented by The Home Depot yet If not then please join us for a registration Happy Hour this Thursday February from to pm at the Hooters Restaurant located at Woodlake Square Houston TX Click on the address for a map Were happy to announce that Hooters will again provide dinner at the new finish line in Austin on Sunday April Applied Materials located on Highway in Austin will host the finish line this year Look for their team on the Tour led by Ken Haase Maps of the route can be found online at mapshtm and in the rider manual If you cant make it this Thursday then join us at one of these other Hooters locations Hooters Anderson Lane Austin to on Tuesday February Hooters FM West to on Thursday February Hooters Round Rock Austin to on Tuesday February Hooters Riverside Downtown Austin to on Tuesday March Hooters NASA to on Thursday March Hooters Mangum to on Thursday March For more information please visit our official website wwwmsorg where you can register online signup for online donations and signup to volunteer Its fast easy and secure If youre not planning to ride then join us as a volunteer Check out the volunteer signup section on the website where you can choose volunteer areas of your choice As of February people have registered online people have made online donations in the amount of people have signed up to volunteer and have signed up on our email subscription list Click here to signup for online donations contributehtm Also check out the Discussion Groups in the Talk to section of our website There are different Discussion Groups where you can post questions suggestions tips advice or comments about the bike tour Whether youre looking for tips on how to train for the ride or how to raise money youll get your answers here Click here to start talking talkhtm Thanks for supporting the National MS Society The National Multiple Sclerosis Society supports more MS research and serves more people with MS than any national voluntary MS organization in the world The National Multiple Sclerosis Society one thing people with MS can count on

Training Rides Feb Forwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Amelia NRON PM To Amelia NRON cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject Training Rides Feb We deliver Heres your choices for the weekend This weeks training ride will leave from Royal Middle School at on Saturday We will try for about miles Thanks to Charla Reese for writing up the Feb th ride summary Kelly OFFICIAL MS TRAINING RIDES Look for the Official ISUZU MS VehiCROSS at both training rides this weekend where you can find out more info about the ISUZU MS You cant miss the vehicle so come by and say hello Saturday February AM Katy Mills Mall miles Sponsored by Sun Ski Sports Sunday February am Chappell Hill Ride miles Sponsored by Planetary Cycles and Shirars Bicycles NORTHWEST CYCLERY The groups split by speed and distance Many groups ride about miles at average speeds of These groups number no more than riders There are also rides of miles as well as the miles at a slower pace for new riders There are refreshments at the startfinish at Tulley Telge Rd More Information Access to the parking lot is off Telge Rd second school entrance after service road Be there by for the start This start time drops to when daylight savings time begins WEST U SCHWINN Jeff Nielsen and the gang invite you to train with them on Saturdays departing West U Schwinn at Rice Blvd at AM for a mile tour of the city Mountain Bikes West U Schwinn also has a Thursday evening ride that is for mountain bikes only miles leaves from the store at PM and ends up at a great restaurant Check out these rides at HOUSTON BICYCLE CLUB Saturday February AM New Ulm or miles Many of your favorite back roads of Austin Fayette and Washington Counties MEET miles NW on I Sealy N on TX Left on FM to New Ulm Turn left block east of FM DO NOT PARK AT THE TAVERN Sunday February AM Northwest Passage mileages to be determined easy ride Explore the scenic areas just north of the Katy Freeway Weave in and out of Timbergrove Manor Sherwood Forest and Brookhollow River Oaks and Memorial for good meassure STARTER Bob Howe MEET Hermann Park Rose Garden parking lot Park nearest Museum of Natural Science Sunday February AM miles AM or miles Katy South Flatlands Route A revised rerun of the Katy Flatland Century Some of our best West Oaks roads and some new ones The maps are marked well Go ahead and try a century Maps will be in Toms car for the ride STARTER Tom Young MEET Katy High School parking lot miles west on I to Katy North on FM mile to Katy High School parking lot Sunday February AM Mountain Biking Cypress Creek Singletrack through pine twisting hardwood forest near Cypress Creek Sandy soil some ditches hills Lots of twisting curvy trails About miles of trails Why Bicycling fun in the dirt with hotdogs cold drinks afterward Hot chocolate if the weather warrants MEET Cypresswood Key map page Kuyendahl and Steubner Airline DONT FORGET TO REGISTER FOR THE BLUEBONNET IF YOU NEED ANY HELP LET US KNOW ALSO REMEMBER THE DEADLINE FOR MS EARLY IS MAR AFTER THAT IT GOES TO

MS training ride scheduleForwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Stephanie Strong PM To Stephanie CT cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject MS training ride schedule Attached is the MS Training Ride Schedule The first ride is this Sunday Jan at am not at Memorial Park I spoke to the folks at West U Schwinn and they verified the time change The meeting area is at the large parking lot before you enter the picnic loop The picnic loop is located on the other side of Memorial across from the running trail If you have any questions please give me a call Thanks PS This ride is for all levels of riders Steph

MS Making a List Checking it TwiceForwarded by Claire BroidoHOUECT on PM Amelia NRON PM To Amelia NRON cc bcc Claire BroidoHOUECT Subject Making a List Checking it Twice Hey Team Here we are weeks away from the MS at and growing Please check the list and if your name is not here and you think it should be please let me know ASAP We have a VERY IMPORTANT DEADLINE on MARCH Thats the day the MS Society determines team size and thats when we qualify for our SUPER START The largest team as of March starts first If you rode with us last year youll recall going out the gate first which is the only way to travel I cant count you as registered unless you let me know youve registered with the MS Society or we have registered you through Enron If you have any friends thinking about joining the team its really important to get that done by March Of course you can still register after that date but the fee raises to and we ask your support in getting all our riders listed as soon as possible THANK YOU FOR RIDING WITH ENRON
